#summary reorder - swaps columns in a delimited flat file

= Usage =
`reorder <options> [file(s)]`
the fields param is exclusive of swap and move - if -f and -m or -s are\nspecified, only -f will be used.\n\nexample: reorder -d : -s 1,3 -m 2,4 /etc/passwd\n\nwould swap fields 1 and 3, and then would move field 2 to position 4.
= Options =
||*Short Opt*||*Long Opt*||Arugment||Description||
||-h||--help|| ||print this message and exit||
||-V||--version|| ||print version info and exit||
||-v||--verbose|| ||print verbose messages during execution||
||-d||--delim||<delim> ||specifies delimiting string||
||-s||--swap||<swap> ||specifies two fields to swap (ex: -s 1,3)||
||-m||--move||<move> ||specifies a field to move to a new position\n\t\t\t\t\t(ex: -s 3,1)||
||-f||--fields||<fields> ||specifies fields to use to create a new string\n\t\t\t\t\t(ex: -f 3,4,1,5,2)||
